attributes.action: Turn off traffic lights for ALL roundabouts outside of peak times.
attributes.background: I drive for a living (as a service engineer) and cover about 25k annually. I am also qualified HGV1 and Motorcyle licence holder. I was a Combat driver in the TA and have also driven articulated commercial vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: The menace of traffic lights on roundabouts is a constant theme of irritation and disbelief amongst the drivers I have spoken with. Many actually ignore them late at night and risk a prosecution rather than adhere to the Highway Code. Additionally, I live near a large motorway access road junction (M27 J8.) The roundabout at the top of the slip road always flows better when the lights breakdown. I have seen this on a few occasions. I drive this roundabout continually to and from work.

attributes.action: Increase the speed limit on roads for vans or put up speed road sign for vans.
attributes.background: When driving a transit type van the national speed limit  is lower for vans than cars. Speed signs are displayed for cars but not vans. Most van drivers also drive a car so it can be confusing when there are no speed respeater signs for vans. Van technology has improved making them safer.

attributes.action: Care homes to be required by law to provide Mario Kart gaming for residents.
attributes.background: This petition was started by a medical student who recently attended an Elderly Medicine placement in Derbyshire. In many Local Authority owned care homes, residents would be sat passively in front of the lounge television screen. Residents may enjoy a competitive, interactive activity instead.
attributes.additional_details: "When groups of generally healthy medical patients aged 50 and over were instructed to play a video game that increased in difficulty and complexity with each new level, researchers at the University of Iowa found that they gained years of cognitive processing improvement after one year of play." Lynn, Kecia (2015). More Proof That Elderly People Should Play More Video Games. Big Think. http://bigthink.com/ideafeed/more-proof-that-elderly-people-should-play-more-video-games

attributes.action: Introduce basic income in the UK for every citizen whether they work or not.
attributes.background: I believe that if everyone receives a basic income, whether they are working or not, it will make citizens feel more equal.
attributes.additional_details: We really do need this proposal to go ahead because there are so many people that are homeless or not at work, and are struggling to live of minimal benefits. So if this basic income is introduced, I feel that less people will be homeless and can live their lives normally.

attributes.action: Put a cap on how many clients carers/nurses can supply care to in healthcare.
attributes.background: In nurseries there is a ratio of 1 nursery nurse per 3 children depending on age. I want the same for the elderly. 1 carer for 4 clients needing care. 1 nurse for 5 clients. This obviously is just an estimate, it depends on other factors and should be looked into.

attributes.action: Receiving Carers Allowance should not affect other benefits or taxes
attributes.background: People who receive Carers Allowance should not have to pay extra tax or have their other benefits cut. People receiving a state pension must also be able to claim Carers Allowance while looking after a loved one. Mandy Bayliffe tried to change things in her short life so now we must.
attributes.additional_details: Carers Allowance should be tax-free, like PIP, and shouldn’t affect any other benefits that carers may receive. I am 67 years old, in receipt of a State Pension, which I paid for through 40 years of work. Yet I cannot claim Carers Allowance because the Government does not allow you to claim both. This means men and women who can claim their State Pensions are excluded. These same people are more often than not by their loved ones sides 24/7 yet receive no recompense for it either.

attributes.action: Scrap the DBS system because most immigrants have no past record.
attributes.background: As a graduate in International Politics/Security I think its wrong for the British people to be penalised when looking for a job just because they have a conviction. When compared to the thousands of immigrants that arrive unlawfully in Britain with no prior record of their past.
attributes.additional_details: Please note, the barred list is a separate issue and is most definitely useful for protecting the vulnerable but just because someone has committed for example financial crime this does not mean that they would hurt someone. I believe this country will lose many of its citizens slowly but surely because one by one people will leave this and travel to where they feel more secure.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies to make unsolicited phone calls selling services.
attributes.background: Enough is enough. Constant daily calls both on landline and mobile regarding PPI, accident claim or financial services etc. Also in text form. There should be heavy penalties to stop them as I believe this practice is an invasion of privacy and morally reprehensible.
attributes.additional_details: I have now 'blocked' over 50 telephone numbers on my iPhone but they still keep coming.

attributes.action: Allow dividends paid to a Sipp in drawdown to be withdrawn tax free up to limit.
attributes.background: Dividends from shares are now tax free up to £5,000 pa. As a Sipp holder, soon to be in drawdown, I have realised that dividends paid to the Sipp, then withdrawn by the pension holder, will be taxed at marginal rate. Pensioners should have the option to withdraw dividends up to £5,000 pa tax free.

attributes.action: Make childhood vaccinations a legal requirement for state-school education
attributes.background: Un-vaccinated children pose a potentially serious risk to the health of other children - particularly those for whom vaccines are less effective or who are medically unable to be vaccinated. Where the failure to vaccinate has no medical basis, other children should be protected.
attributes.additional_details:
Recent years have seen a rise in outbreaks of preventable diseases, which has been at least partially attributed to an increase in parents electing not to have their children vaccinated. These include smallpox (which had been all but eradicated by vaccination), and measles. 
Children are at particular risk, due to the way they play very closely together, and their less developed immune systems.
In Australia, it is already a requirement for receipt of state welfare.

attributes.action: Allow unrestricted work and residency visas for citizens of the commonwealth.
attributes.background: Commonwealth countries such as Canada, New Zealand and Australia have strong historical ties with our nation. Polls suggest all three countries are favourable to the idea, it would help alleviate concerns about mass immigration from countries with dissonant cultural values by offset.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/canadians-support-visa-free-travel-between-some-countries-poll/article29204662/?service=mobile

There are multiple sources that support this, I firmley believe it would ease the discord in our society, also it would provide fantastic opportunities for our citizens to learn about the world and enrich our society. I know it would need to be mutual between these nations but I believe we can start a dialogue, also drop NHS surcharge for those nationals.

attributes.action: To scrap the literacy and numeracy tests for those wanting to become teachers.
attributes.background: These tests are preventing future teachers from beginning their training. There are many requirements that need to be met and the schools and universities that provide the training are losing students because of the governments involvement. The training providers don't even approve of these tests.
attributes.additional_details: Last year I was accepted by a school and university. I had completed my degree, achieved the necessary GCSE results, gained 2 years experience of working in education. However, after 3 attempts I failed the numeracy and I am now frozen out for 2 years. After contacting Nicky Morgan's office, I received a reply stating that I am not ready to be a teacher. The questions that are asked are irrelevant to teaching especially when the tests are not relevant to the subjects that trainees want to teach.

attributes.action: An alternative intergrated solution to Heathrow airport expansion
attributes.background:
Heathrow expansion can only exasperate West London’s housing and congestion problems.
I believe London’s future success and those of rest of UK will best be served by deliberately planning to reduce pressures on London's limited resources. 
Hence this proposal as a two prong solution.
attributes.additional_details:
1)Build a *new* international airport(linked to HS2), of similar size to Heathrow, around Birmingham. 
2)Divert half of all Heathrow's contracts to the new airport. Reducing pressures on London's resources. 
Some of the benefits are
•Sharing traffic between West/North of London. 
•More passenger capacity than a single runway extension.
•Help tourism/service industry in the north of UK. 
•In Emergencies, as both airports are of similar size, they can better cope with diversion of air traffic.

attributes.action: UK public to be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.background: The UK public elect its most influential people, Prime Minister, Chancellor, Home Secretary, Lord Mayor etc as a democracy. The UK public should also be able to elect the Governor of the Bank of England.
attributes.additional_details: The Governor of the Bank of England directly has control over the UK debt, availability of homes, interest rates. The governor also needs to have measurable objectives that his performance can be directly assessed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a company to require men to wear a neck tie at work
attributes.background: It's still legal in the UK for a company to require male members of staff to wear neck ties at work against their will. Dress code laws should be changed so that men have the option to wear neck ties at work, if they wish. Current formal work dress codes are out-dated and sexist.

attributes.action: Allow all students access to clean water during school time.
attributes.background: In many school across the country students have been denied access to clean water during school. Even though everyone in our country has clean, fresh running water that is accessible to everyone many school do not allow students to get water during lessons and school. We cannot allow this to happen

attributes.action: Vote that the house has no confidence in the Prime Minister.
attributes.background: He's not fit to hold the office of Prime Minister because he has knowingly put the UK in a position which he believed will undermine the security of the UK, destabilise Europe and the world economy, diminish the capabilities of our intelligence services and will cause mass unemployment.
attributes.additional_details: He has without necessity called for a referendum which could result in the UKs exit from the EU believing it will be ruinous to the nation.  In numerous speeches made by himself and his ministers have made it abundantly clear that he considers a possible exit from the EU would be disastrous for the economic welfare and security of the nation. He's therefore been derelict in his duty to defend the nation against threat by setting in motion a chain of events he believes will harm the UK.

attributes.action: Move parliament to "Skegness". UK Parliament tour seaside resorts during refurb.
attributes.background: Due to 6 years of repairs to the Palace of Westminster,  parliament will be held in a different location. This petition asks the government to discuss touring seaside towns during the repairs. This would utilise our vast holiday park infrustucture, facilitate regenerration and showcase democracy.

attributes.action: Change the law to stop insurance companies discrimating against people with HIV
attributes.background: Currently people living with HIV, who are healthy and who's health is not at risk can pay astronomically more than those who are not living with the condition when taking out travel insurance. This is compunded by people with the condition being completely discounted from certain insurance cover.

attributes.action: Disband the polices current internal complaints investigation Service & the IPCC
attributes.background:
Two years ago the government voted to allow police to investigate All matters internally.

Instead of putting all cases, of police assualts against civilians or common law breaches, straight to the CPS, 

They now get a chance to cover up the matter or potentially 'falsify' the evidence.
attributes.additional_details:
The current police complaints system, is currently full of potential:

1. Corruption.

2. Conflict of interest - of the investigators knowing the person or persons that they are investigating.

3. Power or knowledge to potentially contaminate the incidence.

4. Potential or knowledge of how to falsify the evidence and manipulate the witness's:

    A. By only asking the right question or by
    misleading the witness into saying the right 
    answer, to allow the true police criminal to walk.

attributes.action: Recognise Care Assistants as an actual career and better pay more than N.M.W.
attributes.background: Care Assistants should be recognised as an actual career path and should be paid better than the National Minimum Wage or 2016 renamed (National Living Wage) and be able to progress up the ladder with educational help available.
attributes.additional_details: People who go into the Vulnerable Adult Sector I.e. Care Assistants work 12 hour shifts sometimes do not even get time to have proper breaks because they are so busy get just the basic national minimum wage regardless of the new name and in some cases just don't even have the option to progress up the ladder this should be changed the minimum age should be changed to 21 to work as a Care Assistant and they should also feel valued Minimum Wage 12 Hour shifts does not make you feel valued.

attributes.action: Call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to engage with constituents
attributes.background: Every four years, EU citizens vote on democratic representatives in the European Parliament (MEPs). Very few people know who their MEP is. If the UK votes to stay in the European Union, the Government must call on the European Parliament to urge MEPs to be more accessible and open to constituents.
attributes.additional_details: Various surveys showing how much people in the UK know about their MEP http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2014/may/10/voters-cant-name-their-mep http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/hands-up-if-you-know-who-your-mep-is-8679242.html

attributes.action: We want a referendum to be held on English membership of the United kingdom.
attributes.background: England would be stronger outside the United Kingdom for the simple reason that Scotland, Wales and Northern island  contribute far less to the Union than they take out. As a result of this England would be stronger outside the UK.

attributes.action: Restrict who can buy UK land and property to uk residents only
attributes.background: It is very concerning that persons who live in other countries and are not resident here are allowed to purchase housing stock, further pushing up prices for uk residents when there are limited resources.

attributes.action: Ban all Pornographic material
attributes.background: Pornography is a fake stimulus which is crippling the expectations and behaviour of more people, the young especially. This industry exploits men and women, into a world where all dignity is degraded and even "shows off" illegal activity such as rape for others to enjoy. This encourages abuse.
attributes.additional_details:
Simply using safety filters is not enough. Many young children can easily by pass these filters, when Government and parents believe their children are safe.(http://www.expertreviews.co.uk/software/internet-security/1402585/how-your-kids-are-beating-your-parental-controls-and-is-there). 
One main argument for porn is that it helps couples. In more cases than not it DESTROYS relationships. (https://www.psychologytoday.com/blog/tech-support/201407/what-porn-does-intimacy). So what is it for?

attributes.action: UK should double its Gold because other central banks are buying up all the gold
attributes.background: Gold is money and has been for thousands of years. The money we use today is the faith backed fiat system.People have started to loose faith in the dollar and all other fiat currencies like the Euro.The only way forward is a gold backed currency.
attributes.additional_details:
Interesting websites regarding gold as money

HTTPS://www.hiddensecretsofmoney.com
Http://kingworldnews.com
Http://www.dailyreckoning.co.uk

attributes.action: Drivers to take a refresher driving test when renewing their driving licence.
attributes.background: The standard of driving in the United Kingdom has deteriorated dramatically in recent years, and the problem is that once a driver has passed their test, they can drive on a UK licence until they reach 70 years of age. In order to reduce accidents, we need a new, more proactive approach.

attributes.action: Introduce topics about gender equality and racial equality to the curriculum.
attributes.background: School is supposed to provide people an education so that they be ready for the 'real world'. What is the point when people aren't educated on social justice matters? The lack of education on racial and gender issues leaves a lot of people growing up with narrow-minded and ignorant opinions.
attributes.additional_details: I know first hand that the majority of boys in school will continue to think it is acceptable to objectify and show little respect to girls. In addition, many of the students will think it is okay to make racist remarks because they don't know any better. There is a platform that reaches these students' minds and can influence their thinking. We need to make it so they won't leave school uneducated on basic respect and social issues.

attributes.action: UK Government to allow people to only claim asylum from UK Embassy's
attributes.background: I want this to be debated in parliament because i believe this will save people using dangerous methods in trying to reach the UK mainland from places like Calais and also putting the lives of truck drivers at risk. It will also reduce funding for the criminal gangs taking advantage of their plight.

attributes.action: Compulsory yearly test for secondary school teachers in their respective subject
attributes.background: Secondary school teachers that teach GCSE or A-Level classes should take the respective test in their subject every year and score very highly to ensure that the teaching standards are adequate throughout the nations' schools.
attributes.additional_details: If students are to perform well at school they should be taught by teachers that have throughout knowledge of the curriculum. It would also ensure equality as a student should not be at a disadvantage to their peers if they have a teacher who is not able to teach the curriculum to a satisfactory standard. Failure of the teacher to score highly on the tests they are teaching to should result in intervention and perhaps further training.

attributes.action: Scrap Air Passenger Duty (APD) on all UK flights
attributes.background:
Air Passenger Duty (APD) is the UK Government tax that is currently being charged on all passengers departing from a UK airport. Which since introduction in 1994, has risen by up to 539%.

Abolishing APD would see a significant increase in the UK’s GDP as well as the creation thousands of jobs.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK ranks 137th out of 138 when it comes to air ticket taxes and charges - 2015 World Economic Forum’s Travel and Tourism Competitiveness Report.

Only six EU countries levy a similar tax, but with substantially lower rates than those in the UK.

The high charges of APD are severely hindering economic growth in the UK's Transport and Leisure Industry. In order to boost economic growth and improve competitiveness in the market, I urge the UK government to scrap APD.

attributes.action: I would like to see the regulation of Management Agencies for new build flats
attributes.background: I pay a managing agent a large fee for my new build flat. The managing agent has destroyed our sinking fund and charged us an obscene amount for 'changing bulbs' - They have no one to answer to! Millions of homeowners have to succumb to these agencies who are ever increasing service charges.

attributes.action: Make the UK safer place from terrorism.
attributes.background: Allow non uniform police and HM Forces personnel aswell as ex services to be allowed to carry a short barrel weapon assuming they have passed all annual training directives (A.D.T).Terrorism is now becoming the number one subject in our daily lives,people are constantly under threat.
attributes.additional_details: An observation made this week by myself whilst walking through a main line London tube station showed our only defence in London "The Metropolitan Police" looking at the ground constantly whilst on patrol. Is London safe? Who knows when terrorism may occur the main question is are we ready to defend our selfs and others?

attributes.action: Scrap emission based VED on private vehicles as it takes no account of miles pa
attributes.background:
Emission based VED takes no account of mileage.
A high VED vehicle paying £505 pa may only do 3000 miles pa and another vehicle paying £120 pa 20,000 miles pa
Have a basic VED for all  private vehicles incl electric and the rest  funded by tax on fuel for a pro rata rate of road usage

attributes.action: Ban the use of opinion polls in the run up to elections and referenda.
attributes.background: Opinion polls have become tools for influencing people's voting decisions and should be completely banned.
attributes.additional_details: The 2015 General Election was badly affected by them and so will the EU referendum.

attributes.action: Stop the government from forcing mathematics on children until they are 18.
attributes.background: The government want children to study maths in schools until they are 18. At this age people are preparing to start careers and will know whether or not they need maths to start their career. At 16-18 the focus should be on supporting children's ambitions. People's choices are being taken away.

attributes.action: We believe the Government should increase fuel duty to protect PIP payments.
attributes.background:
In this year's Budget, the Chancellor made changes to PIP.
The role of Government is to protect the most vulnerable.
By cutting PIP payments, the Government is taking away a vital source of income to those who need it the most.
We believe fuel duty should be increased by 2p a litre to protect PIP

attributes.action: Deport Foreign Criminals Earlier Increase ERS Scheme Time from 9 to 18 months
attributes.background: A Foreign Criminal cost the same as a Uk Criminal Depending on the Prison a Prisoner cost the tax payers up to 33,000 pounds and year , deporting a foreign criminal early to there home country up to 18 months before their sentence expires will save huge amounts of money
attributes.additional_details: there is over 10,000 foreign criminals in uk prisons , giving them enough time off as an incentive will help them in there decision whether to stay and fight to remain or voluntarily request to be removed. Most criminals will jump at the opportunity to be sent back to there home country 18 months early rather than the 9 months already in place under the ERs scheme with the home office

attributes.action: Ask Saudi government to stop executing young innocent people
attributes.background: Saudi government has arrested 17 years old innocent Ali Nammer . Now the family has been threatened that they will execute him in next 24 hours . We request to put pressure on Saudi authorities to cancel their decision and release them

attributes.action: Reject proposals to increase Insurance Premium Tax
attributes.background: The Chancellor may use the budget to increase insurance premium tax (IPT) as he did last year. This may seem an obscure tax but it will heavily  impact those paying the highest premiums already - the young and those who live in high risk areas - often the people least able to afford any increase.
attributes.additional_details: In the last budget the Chancellor increased IPT from 6% to 9.5%. Rumours are taht he may increase it a further 3% which would put £37 on the average car insurance premium. It would also increase home, pet and medical insurance as well as car breakdown cover. It is a pernicious tax because, while it affects everyone, it disproportionately affects the young and those who live in high risk areas who are least likely to be able to afford it.

attributes.action: Block Recep Tayyip Erdogan from coming to UK
attributes.background: His double standards on terrorism (by allowing the wounded terrorists in his country), deporting of Kurds (who are 100% against ISIS) and setting the ME very unstable are his violations of International Law. He must not be allowed to speak in UK!

attributes.action: Review air quality in all airline planes cabins and cockpits-aerotoxic syndrome
attributes.background: Cabin air quality is a very serious health and safety issue which needs to be reviewed by the government in which to make certain of the passengers safety on board aircraft.. This is so that they're is evidence for traces of oil fumes in the cabin air from the engines. Which is deadly and can kill.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence for this is toxicology reports from high class doctors examining organs for traces of engine oil. Reports in many newspapers have stated that it is a serious matter and has killed before. You are unable to know whether that the air is contaminated with the naked eye so passengers are unaware. This can have worse effects on different people. A review needs to be conducted on traces of fumes in the cabin during flight. Filters should be installed to prevent particles getting in.

attributes.action: Clean slate for juvenile offences commited before 18 years old. A second chance
attributes.background: I believe it's unfair to hold mistakes people make as a minor/juvenile to stay with them for the rest of their life. The DBS filtering systerm is simply not good enough, they have been judged already lets not keep judging them 20 years later.
attributes.additional_details: I feel a more fair systerm should be in place. Low level offenders who have not ever served a custodial sentance should be able to move past their mistakes and not have a lack of judgement follow them for life. I propose if an offender does not re-offend between the ages of 18-21 by the time they are 21 other then DNA and fingerprints no record should be held about the young person in regards to arrests and convictions.

attributes.action: Stop the increment of car insurance premium with "No Blame" accidents.
attributes.background: Lot of insurance companies increasing the insurance premium of the drivers who were involved in "no blame " accidents. Many driver got hit from behind by another driver while on stall position and ended up paying 30% extra insurance premium during their next renewal. This is unfair for many drivers.
attributes.additional_details: Many people around the UK paying extra car insurance premium just for getting involved in an accident, despite it wasn't their fault at all. I have been hit by a speeding vehicle while waiting in the traffic light and my insurance now gone up by 110%. I spoke to many people around the country and they are suffering from the same fate. This is very fraudulent behavior of the insurance companies to form out money from both parties with any excuse. "No blame" accident sufferers should not pay extra

attributes.action: Change all road signs to display metric measurements in the United Kingdom
attributes.background: In the UK, we have an outstanding problem. The continued mix-up of both metric and imperial measurements in our society confuses the great British people, especially to the younger generation. Completing the change to an easy and logical measuring system would be both inexpensive and simple.
attributes.additional_details: We buy our fuel for vehicles in litres, however the efficiency of cars is measured in "miles per gallon". Car manufacturers design the dimensions of cars in metric measurements however our roads signs display imperial. Old-fashioned measurements bring confusion to people from other societies and can lead to road accidents due to different measurement restrictions. Changing our road signage to display distance in metres and kilometres, vehicle restrictions in metres and speed given in kilometres per hour will help to end the in-consistency of measurements in the UK.

attributes.action: Introduce banking skills to the secondary curriculum.
attributes.background: I believe that it is important that the use of banking services be a mandatory part of the secondary school curriculum as it would appear, from anecdotal reports and observation that many teenagers simply do not understand how to use basic banking services.

attributes.action: Change the location of the layby on the A38 southbound near Ripley
attributes.background: As there have been a couple of accidents here and recently the loss of a motorcyclist vs a HGV earlier this week. The layby is so close to the sliproad that people mistake it for one. Which needs to be changed before this happens again. The last one was a fatality. Let's leave it at that!

attributes.action: Educate society about Epilepsy and eradicate the stigma surrounding it
attributes.background: More than 500,000 people in the UK have epilepsy, which is a condition that affects the brain and causes repetitive seizures. There is a stigma around epilepsy that needs to be addressed, starting with the lack of knowledge the public have about what to do when someone has a seizure.
attributes.additional_details: Educating children from a young age in a First Aid class would severely decrease the stigma around epilepsy and therefore allow those with epilepsy to feel more accepted in the community. By placing a programme of First Aid in primary and secondary schools where children learn about what to do when witnessing a seizure- not touching the person or placing anything in their mouths etc- would make epilepsy a much less lonely and frightening condition.

attributes.action: Discuss the need for a national register for non-participatory fathers.
attributes.background: I feel this register is much needed and highly overdue. Fathers who have children and then, (when it doesn't work with their co-creators) decide to penalise their own children by not regularly visiting, contributing or communicating. This Leaves the mother to counsell their young 'damaged' kids..
attributes.additional_details: I posted an enquiry if a register like this existed, and found one did but only for Domestic Violence (Clare's Law). However, this doesn't help those mothers (generally) who deal with their co-creators choice to not participate. A register is needed because it's a highly common issue, often seeing the same (mostly) men 're-offend' and go on to ruin even more young minds of growing children. This perpetual cycle often repeated could easily be stopped with a register. Divorce is common, so is this

attributes.action: Take action to break the siege in Aleppo and enforce a no bombing zone.
attributes.background: Send a message to the people of Aleppo to say that we are listening and we are taking action. We will apply pressure on our government to do more.
attributes.additional_details:
Dr. Hatem, Director of the Aleppo Children’s Hospital run by the Independent Doctor’s Association (IDA): 
"We need the international community. And that means pressure from you. Tell your government, tell the UN, tell every international institution that the world can still break the siege and stop the bombs. Please, save us. Save Aleppo."
